column4: Is it a security feature or something to not be able to sudo su from certain users? I have to change to administrator before it recognizes my password on version 7.04
well, you shouldn't 'sudo su' anyway.  Use 'sudo -i' if you need to.  But, only users in the "admin" group can use sudo
ah that makes more sense. I got scared thinking it lost my password before I realized the pattern
you can't.  You can reset it though
